abstract_summ: For each type of cancer–colon, pancreas, oesogastric, hepatocellular carcinoma–morbidity and mortality rates are stated and compared with the oncological risk incurred by deferring surgery and/or the tumour doubling time.It is necessary, at this time, to make an additional effort to develop tools that can facilitate the care of bladder carcinoma and minimize the impact and risks for patients and health professionals in the future.The aim of this study was to report the experience in managing sarcoma patients and the reorganization of a cancer center in an attempt to maintain it free from COVID-19.CONCLUSIONS: We describe the use of actively managed surgical triage to fairly balance our patient's health with public health concerns.Patients with low‐grade cancers were advised to delay surgery, and other difficult decisions were made.
